Paragraph: In one recording a short period of regular sinus rhythm with intermittent 2 / 1 S - A block was observed .

Let's think step by step.

1. Sinus rhythm: This refers to a normal electrical activity of the heart, where the electrical impulses originate from the sinoatrial node (SA node) in the right atrium and spread throughout the heart in a regular pattern. It is not a chemical entity but rather a physiological condition.

2. Intermittent 2 / 1 S - A block: This is an electrical conduction disorder, specifically a type of second-degree heart block. A heart block occurs when there is an interruption in the electrical conduction system of the heart. In a 2:1 S-A block, every other atrial impulse is not conducted to the ventricles. This condition is not a chemical entity but rather a physiological condition.
